definitions.definition: prevent (someone or something) from doing something; keep under control or within limits.
examples: he had to be restrained from walking out of the meeting
synonyms: hold back "she could barely restrain herself from swearing"

definitions.definition: prevent oneself from displaying or giving way to (a strong urge or emotion).
examples: Amos had to restrain his impatience
synonyms: rein back/in; informalkeep the lid on "Charles restrained his anger"

definitions.definition: deprive (someone) of freedom of movement or personal liberty.
examples: leg cuffs are used in the U.S. for restraining and transporting extremely violent and dangerous criminals
synonyms: put in irons; informalhog-tie "that beast ought to be restrained"

definitions.definition: (of a seat belt) hold (a person or part of their body) down and back while in a vehicle seat.
